awd_abstract_narration:
A request is made to fund Oceanographic Instrumentation on R/V Atlantic Explorer, a 168’ general purpose research vessel owned and operated by Bermuda Institute of Ocean Science (BIOS) as part of the United States Academic Research Fleet (ARF).  BIOS is a U.S. 501 (c) 3 and 509 (a) not-for-profit research and educational institution incorporated in the state of New York, and geographically located on the Island of Bermuda. The mission of the ship is to support funded science research throughout the Central Atlantic but specifically work in support of the Bermuda Atlantic Time-series (BATS) program. RV Atlantic Explorer had 130 days funded, in the pandemic-shortened season in 2020, all of which were for NSF. In 2021, the vessel is scheduled to sail 206 days with 183 (89%) of them funded by NSF. With this proposal, BIOS provides technical descriptions and rationale for the acquisition of the following Instrumentation:	
	
Trimble ABX-Two	$10,362	
MilliQ & Elix	$17,222	
	$5,495	
(2) VHF Antennas	$2,500	
Spare computer x 2	$2,062	
KVM Switch, keyboard, mouse	$1,238	
CCTV	$4,350	
Foul weather gear	$1,500	
Media for lounge	$1,200	
	$45,929
	
Broader Impacts							
The principal impact of the present proposal is under Merit Review Criterion 2 of the Proposal Guidelines (NSF 19-602). It provides infrastructure support for scientists to use the vessel and its shared-use instrumentation in support of their NSF-funded oceanographic research projects (which individually undergo separate review by the relevant research program of NSF).  The acquisition, maintenance and operation of shared-use instrumentation allows NSF-funded researchers from any US university or lab access to working, calibrated instruments for their research, reducing the cost of that research, and expanding the base of potential researchers.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

inst.inst_name: Bermuda Institute of Ocean Sciences (BIOS), Inc.
inst.org_lgl_bus_name: BERMUDA INSTITUTE OF OCEAN SCIENCES (BIOS) INC.

perf_inst.perf_inst_name: Bermuda Institute of Ocean Sciences (BIOS), Inc.

por.por_cntn:
The Trimble ABX Two was installed in March 2021 and has proven to be a suitable replacement to the ADU800. Data has been primary used to enhance the ship's hull mounted 75kHz ADCP. Without the pitch and roll data from the ABX Two, the ADCP data would be of very poor quality. We plan on installing a 300kHz ADCP in late 2023 to compliment the 75kHz. The 300kHz will also benefit from the presence of the ABX Two. The GPS and attitude data streams from the ABX Two are also utilised elsewhere onboard.

The data is collected and stored on one of our dataloggers alongside data from our other navigation instruments. This is presented to the science party at the end of the cruise alongside the other datasets such as CTD, metorological etc.

The data streams from the sensor are utilized by navigation equipment on the bridge. In the event of an outage of the primary feed, they will failover to the stream from the ABX Two.

Data streams have been used by a MATE intern earlier this year to enhance her coding skills. She parsed out some data from the strings and stored them on a practise datalogger alongside data from other sensors/instruments.

This award has aided and improved the operation of the R/V Atlantic Explorer at sea.


 


Last Modified: 07/30/2023
Modified by: Nicholas R Bates
